thread.title: Game of Thrones looks set to air major storyline from the books in season six - Game of Thrones Cult -
thread.title_full: Game of Thrones looks set to air major storyline from the books in season six - Game of Thrones News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Ian Sandwell
title: Game of Thrones looks set to air major storyline from the books in season six - Game of Thrones Cult -
text: Warning: This article contains spoilers that some readers may prefer to avoidGame of Thrones is set to return to a major location.According to Watchers on the Wall, season six will reportedly feature a previously unseen Riverrun book storyline. © HBOGame of Thrones - Season 3: Clive Russell as Brynden "The Blackfish" Tully Game of Thrones season 6: Everything we know so far from plot spoilers to premiere dateThe siege of Riverrun will mark the return of Clive Russell as Catelyn Stark's uncle Brynden Tully, aka The Blackfish, who was last seen during season three's shocking Red Wedding.Russell was seen filming in Northern Ireland, along with Nikolaj Coster-Waldau (Jaime Lannister) and Jerome Flynn (Bronn).This would be in line with a storyline from the fourth book, A Feast For Crows, although the main difference for the HBO series is the presence of Bronn.The return to Riverrun could also open up the possibility that book readers will finally get their wish of seeing Lady Stoneheart in season six. © HBOBronn (Jerome Flynn) and Jaime Lannister (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) Meanwhile, it was recently announced that Melanie Lyburd has joined season six in a role similar to that of the Red Woman Melisandre.We also know that David Bradley will likely be back for season six as the scheming Walder Frey and the debate rages on about Jon Snow's fate.Alongside these Game of Thrones veterans will be new cast members Max von Sydow, Ian McShane, Richard E Grant, Freddie Stroma, Essie Davis, Pilou Asbæk and James Faulkner.Game of Thrones will return in April on HBO in the US and Sky Atlantic in the UK.
